content:
Current triaging schedule, June 11th, 2020
monday - @JohnCSimon
tues - @JoelPalmer
wed - @Alex Macleod
thurs - @Elinvynia
fri - @crlf0710
sat - @Muirrum
sun - @huyuumi / vacant
Note that these are discord ids.
I'm @crlf0710 above.
Associated Zulip accounts I found: John Simon Joel Palmer Alex Macleod Elinvynia Charles Lew

Note for newcomers: on Zulip there exists what I call "non-pinging mentions", which are mentions that don't notify people. I wish Discord had a similar feature :D
You can have a non-pinging mention by inserting a _ after the @, e.g. @_**LeSeulArtichaut**
with LeSaulArtichaut replying here, i'm already seeing the benefit of moving to zulip :laughter_tears:
:sweat_smile:
Yeah I know my jokes are the best
noting that I am @Muirrum on Discord and will be taking Saturday.
Welcome @Owen Salter! Don't mind me, I'm not even part of the Triage WG but it seems like DPC wants me to reply here.

Also @DPC, you misspelled my name. It's LeSeulArtichaut with an e, not an a.

Don't think I'll let that happen when you when your reproach me to misspell dtolnay. I never forget. :laughing:
@Charles Lew Hello, can you swap me with @Muirrum?
Zulip posts become uneditable after a certain time period. You can just copy paste and post a new one below i think ... @Elinvynia
the swap is temporary btw just till end of July. So don't worry about editing the schedule
@Elinvynia what day is that?
@Owen Salter You'll have Thursday for this month I believe
Alright, that works
yep. Owen takes thursdays and Elinvynia takes saturday till end of July

New schedule w.e.f 12.10.2020:

monday - John C Simon
tues - Joel Palmer
wed - Alex Macleod
thurs - Camelid / Elinvynia
fri - Charles Lew
sat - Muirrum
sun - vacant (or can be occasionally done by LeSeulArtichaut or Joshua Nelson

New schedule w.e.f 11.11.2020:

monday - John C Simon
tues - Joel Palmer
wed - Alex Macleod
thurs - Camelid / Elinvynia
fri - Charles Lew
sat - < vacant >
sun - vacant (or can be occasionally done by LeSeulArtichaut or Joshua Nelson
FYI, usually the times I do intermittent triage are Tuesday or Thursday, those are the nights I have math homework due :joy:

I'd like to help with doing triage, but I'm not sure what the proper procedure is. Is this written somewhere? I've also recently come across many older issues which seem stale and should be closed. Is it fine to just leave comments on them asking them to be closed?

@Ryan Levick There's description text at https://forge.rust-lang.org/release/triage-procedure.html though some text of it might be a little out of date. Currently we're mostly focusing on triaging PRs and we triage issues now and then.
/me will give it a read
I'm still confused about what I should do about single issues I find that should be closed. For instance, #68177 is a duplicate. Can I mark as duplicate and close?

yea, marking as a duplicate so there's some cross linking between the duplicates and closing the duplicates is fine. It doesn't have to be the oldest issue that is the root issue, but preferrably the best documented issue
And how does one mark as duplicate as there is no duplicate label?
I have never managed to figure out how github does it's special duplicate marking that it has
Mostly we just close it and leave a comment linking to the other issue
Well @DPC just closed this issue :blush:
I don't have permissions to close issues anyway, so this was perhaps a mute point, but maybe I'll have those permissions at some point
you can submit a list of issues that I can go through and close them if needed
with regards to what we do: here is a summary from previous "briefing" https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/242269-t-release.2Ftriage/topic/Meeting.202020-10-07/near/212583097
